subject: Re: [junit] Global variable?
msgSnippet: JUnit loads each TestCase in it s own classloader. Therefore, a variable created in one will not be visible across the next testcase due to another
messageBody:
JUnit loads each TestCase in it's own classloader.
Therefore, a variable created in one will not be
"visible" across the next testcase due to another
classloader loading it, directly. You might be able to
share variables in a Map of some sort using a
Singleton helper class.

Or, you can use a TestSuite I believe and set a
variable that all TestCase instances can share...
forget if this work.

I created my own test harness TestRunner, that allow
my tests to access a global attribute system that
works on a per testcase, and a per test suite (one for
each). My Harness framework breaks things down into
"parts", each Part being a junit Test implementation
(junit TestCase, jfcUnit JFCTestCase, etc all
implement/extend junit's Test). It's a long story, but
it works.
